column43: Did you notice a difference between the two control conditions? Please elaborate.
column44: Which control condition did you prefer? Please explain why.
column45: Did you notice a difference in how you executed the task using condition 1 (disconnected) , versus using condition 2 (connected)? Please elaborate
column46: Do you have any other thoughts?

column26: My arm got tired pretty quickly. Furthermore, the field of view was sometimes obstructed by my arm causing to miss the spawn of blocks on the right side.
column42: Less physically stressing than the situating control condition.
column44: Disconnected control condition: It was physically easier to sustain the movements.
column45: I was less focused on the interaction between my hand and the robot in the disconnected control situation, subjectively making it feel easier to control the robot.

column43: Yes, situated control was a bit harder to control and for me more arm muscles were needed.
column44: Disconnected control. Was easier to control and required less muscle activity.
column45: A little bit of a difference. With situated control I made more mistakes which cost time
Niet een heel groot verschil, bij de eerste moest ik mn arm meer strekken, waardoor ik het idee had dat hij hem wat beter pakte

column43: Yes, the first one felt more like a controller of the robot arm while the second one was more like being the robot arm itself.
column44: 1, less glitches, hands did not obstruct the view of the robot-arm, you didn't have to look down as much as in condition 2.
column45: Yes, in condition 2 I was trying to get the best tracking of my hand. In condition 1 I was just hitting the blocks without thinking.

column42: Felt really natural in the middle visible area, a bit less on the sides
column43: The disconnected one felt a bit smoother, but that could be because after a while you get used to the movements.
column44: The disconnected one because I could see more of the stuff I was doing instead of blocking it with my own hand. Felt like I was more in control
column45: In the disconnected experiment it started to feel like a reflex movement, where the connected experiment asked more of my actual focus
column46: At both experiments it felt like reaching to a red block that was on the far sides was a larger distance than I estimated. Sometimes I missed the block because of that
